newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Three die as Dutch fog causes traffic chaos.
newsitem.headline: Three die as Dutch fog causes traffic chaos.

text.p: Three people were killed and 15 seriously injured in motorway pile-ups in thick fog across the Netherlands on Friday, authorities said.
Around 100 vehicles were involved in the biggest accident, on the A9 highway between Haarlem and Badhoevedorp to the south-west of Amsterdam, a traffic police spokesman said.
"Two motorists were killed outright and another later died in hospital," Alfred Kersaan said. He said 39 people had been hurt, 15 of them seriously.
A string of other pile-ups in the northern and central Netherlands involved several hundred vehicles but there were no reports of serious injuries, he said.
Six people were killed in a head-on collision in thick fog near Stroe, central Netherlands, late Thursday night. A seventh person is still seriously ill in hospital.
